content.description: Start standing from jug-hueco. Bust move up and right to nice rib-jug. Up left to another jug-hueco. Negotiate a cruxy sloper and little ear grip to gain big jugs. Top out straight on through good sidepulls.
content.location: Northeast-ish side of boulder, climber-right side of patio.

content.description: Far right side of north face. Big jug start, then up groove pinches, huecos and scooper holds to top out.
Jug start up through huecoy bits, slope-jugs, and undercling and reach to a nice left pinch up high.
Stand start in horizontal break. Fat undercling up to 'shark's mouth' hold on face--a positive incut flake. Match up and get feet right for a long move up to great hold. Finish up jugs.
content.location: Right of Cliffhanger problem. Up clean face with a roundish, shark mouth-shaped hole or scar about 10' up.

content.description: Roll on up through jugs, pockets, and unique holds to top out. Just right of Fish Mouth on face.

A pretty cool, hard project. Two obvious starting points (standing, or for more difficulty, sitting start). Would be shared start to Old Greg, then move right into undercling and bad slope-pinch, setting you up for a final power dumptruck grunt move on groovy, waterstained face.
content.location: Probably same start as Old Greg, then totally independent up and right.

content.description: A great problem with fun, powerful jump-and-smack move. Start matched in undercling crimp, get set on sloper left and positive pinch-right, then make big move up to left sloper. A final tricky move gets up to mega top out jugs. Top out has amazing and surprising jugs when you need them most.
content.location: Northeast-ish side, off patio, right of Chief Wauhatchie.

content.description: Great moves and holds right up face. Central pocket/edge gets you to awesome left sidepull jug at top.
Cool problem with funky holds starting on hammerhead/hourglass feature. Sit start on twin sidepulls. Crank undercling move. Fiddle through funk meathooks and a techy undercling top out.
content.location: On dirt slope, right of end of patio. Northeast-ish side of boulder.

content.description: Graffiti eye ball face area of boulder. A slopey match start, then quick pop up and left to juggin and underclingin. A fun one with cool movement.
A fun one with neat heel-reach move. Sit start with some dirty smear feet. Move through nice crimps up to jugs. Reset for long, heel move up into fish mouth. Transition over into jugs then top out.
content.location: On dirt slope where it meets mtn bike trail and transitions to other side of boulder.

content.description: Float like a butterfly sting like a dirt dobber. Traverse on the lowest horizontal rail system on the back side of the boulder. Starting at the jug arete/horn feature go all the way to the tree and then up. Another St Elmo dirty eliminate classic.Â
A great, tall warm up off the left side of the patio. Jug start, then up and left to top out through wide groove.
content.location: Climbers-left side of patio, 8' right of old stone wall.

content.description: Positive, juggy, and friendly topout. Stand start on big jug. Bust up through very incut features to big sidepull feature--kinda a right-facing mini corner. Honk the big jug horn then move right to top out on great holds. Traverse in from jug start of Yo Bro Adventures to make a nice longer V3/4.
content.location: Up on dirt slope, just right of end of patio.

content.description: A super-fun, long rightward move makes this a worthy variation. Start up Cheif Wau., but at jugs at 8', reset and do big move up and right into a right-hand sloper-jug in the groove. Finish up and right on unique holds, through the groove.
content.location: Chief Wau., then a bit right at top.

content.description: The main line with an obvious sit start in juggy pocket. Crank up through incut jugs, out to left sidepull, then set high feet for the move the a juggy loaf--whack! Finish up incuts and jugs.
content.location: East face of boulder, central line on patio, right of Shark Mouth. Start at obvious, low, juggy pocket/hueco.

content.description: Sit start underneath Chip and Lindsay's Adventure hugging the ledge. Powerful move up to underling. Continue up and slightly right to a small crack. Fire upwards. Easy top out.Â
content.location: Underneath Chip and Lindsay's Adventure. Start is just under to the right of the grafitti

pathTokens: Boulders on Old Wauhatchie Pike, The

content.description: The big one. This big boulder has lines all the way around it, from easy to hard, and lots in the V0-4 range. Huecos, scoops and pockets lend a fund climbing style. Often 3/4 height jugs make for a logical drop-off spot if you're not feeling the tall top outs. Descend via the pine tree. If climbing on the back, share the space with mountain bikers and be courteous.
